author: @ZeeBusiness
title: Final Trade: Sensex tumbles 1,038 pts, Nifty slips below 24,300; PSU banks drag
text:
Final Trade: Sensex tumbles 1,038 pts, Nifty slips below 24,300; PSU banks drag
Equity indices face heavy selling pressure; broader markets outperform but breadth remains weak with more declines than gains.
The headline equity indices continued to witness major losses in mid-afternoon trade on Tuesday. The Nifty fell below the 24,350 mark, while the Sensex tumbled over 1,038 points, trading at 80,710, down 1.27 percent at 3:20 PM IST.
PSU banks slide
PSU bank shares led the decline after posting gains in the previous session, dragging the market sentiment further into negative territory.
Broader markets outperform
Despite losses in large-cap indices, the broader market showed resilience. The S&P BSE Mid-Cap index slipped 0.66 percent, and the S&P BSE Small-Cap index was down 0.46 percent.
Market breadth signals weakness
The market breadth on the BSE remained weak. Out of the total shares traded:
- 1,579 stocks advanced
- 2,389 stocks declined
- 106 stocks remained unchanged
Investors are treading cautiously amid global uncertainties and pressure on domestic equities, particularly in PSU sectors.
